p.value: Donated by Herman Brown, 1996. The accession number associated with this gift is 1984.017.

The collection is arranged in alphabetical order by folder title.  The inventory lists box and folder numbers for an alphabetical range of titles.  Folder titles that consist of a large amount of material are listed individually.

The Jewish Labor Committee (JLC) was founded in 1934 by Jewish labor union leaders with Jewish cultural associations to act in response to the rise of the Nazi Party in Europe.  Before and during World War II, the JLC raised funds and organized people to fight the spread of the Nazi Party.  Since the 1950s the JLC has worked to facilitate cooperation and communication between the Jewish community and labor, focusing on fighting prejudice and discrimination in the workforce.  The Jewish Labor Committee Northeast Region is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts and works with labor unions and organizations, religious organizations, and cultural organizations throughout New England.

subject.value: Labor unions and education -- United States.

abstract.value: The Jewish Labor Committee (JLC) was founded in 1934 by Jewish labor union leaders along with Jewish cultural associations to act in response to the rise of the Nazi Party in Europe.  Before and during World War II, the JLC raised funds and organized people to fight the spread of the Nazi Party.  Since the 1950s the JLC has worked to facilitate cooperation and communication between the Jewish community and labor, focusing on fighting prejudice and discrimination in the workforce.  The Jewish Labor Committee Northeast Region Records document the work of the JLC office based in Boston, Massachusetts.  The collection consists of subject files compiled by Herman Brown, the regional director of the JLC's Northeast Region, and dates between 1963 and 2002, with the bulk of the material dating between 1986 and 1998.  These files contain correspondence, clippings, reports, and publications regarding the work of the JLC in New England.

langmaterial.value: The bulk of the material is in English, with some materials in Hebrew and Russian.

physloc.value: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Jewish Labor Committee Northeast Region Records; WAG 159; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

The original order of the collection consisted of three alphabetical runs of subject files, separated loosely by date.  These runs contained the same folder titles and types of material in each, and were combined into one alphabetical run.
Materials were rehoused in acid-free folders.
The following Jewish Labor Committee materials are located at this repository:

Jewish Labor Committee (U.S.) Records, Parts I (WAG 025.001), II (WAG 025.002), and III (WAG 025.003)
 
Jewish Labor Committee, Chicago Records and Photographs (WAG 160)
Jewish Labor Committee (U.S.) Oral History Collection (OH 027)
Issues of JLC Review (HD8055.J4 A1), JLC Outlook (HD8055.J4 A17), and JLC Civil Rights Newsletter (JC585 .J533).

The Jewish Labor Committee Northeast Region Records document the work of the Jewish Labor Committee in New England, and dates between 1963 and 2002, with the bulk of the material dating between 1986 and 1998.  The collection consists of subject files compiled by Herman Brown, the regional director of the Jewish Labor Committee's (JLC) Northeast Region.  The files document the work of the JLC in New England, mainly in Massachusetts, through correspondence, clippings, reports, and publications.  The correspondence documents the JLC's work with labor organizations, religious groups, cultural organizations, and government agencies to provide training, lobby for and against legislation, and organize events amongst these groups.  The clippings and publications reflect the interests and work of the JLC and its partners.  The reports document JLC meetings and programs, as well as conferences, trainings, and events sponsored by other groups.

Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Jewish Labor Committee Northeast Region were transferred to New York University in February 1996 by Herman Brown. Permission to publish or reproduce materials in this collection must be secured from the Tamiment Library & Robert F. Wagner Archives. Please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu.
